original_text:
**INSTITUTION
GENERAL MEDICINE
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN PROGRESS NOTE
PATIENT NAME :
**NAME[AAA , BBB M]
ACCOUNT # :
**ID-NUM
**ROOM
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN :
**NAME[YYY]
**NAME[ZZZ]
ADMISSION DATE :
**DATE[Jul 17 2007]
EVALUATION DATE :
**DATE[Jul 18 07]
Date of service is **DATE[Jul 18 2007] .
CHIEF COMPLAINT :
Chest discomfort ( heaviness ) .
HOSPITAL COURSE :
Ms. **NAME[AAA] is an **AGE[in 80s]- year - old white woman who was admitted from a rehabilitation facility , where she is currently placed .
She experienced chest discomfort at rest which was described as transient and lasted for a couple of minutes .
She described the sensation as central in location with no radiation to chest , jaw , or back .
No history of any palpitations , dyspnea .
The patient has a diagnosis of pulmonary fibrosis , sleeps slightly inclined at 30 to 40 degrees at home with two to three pillows , as well as pedal edema .
She was actually prescribed home oxygen but she seldom uses .
She is currently not on any daily diuretics .
PAST MEDICAL HISTORY :
1. Type 2 diabetes for three years .
2. Hypothyroidism .
3. Dyslipidemia .
4. Senile macular degeneration .
5. Pulmonary fibrosis .
6. Gout .
7. Hyperparathyroidism , " primary ."
8. Depression .
CURRENT MEDICATIONS :
1. Aspirin 81 mg p.o. daily .
2. Pepcid 10 mg p.o. daily .
3. Fluoxetine 40 mg p.o. daily .
4. Lasix 40 mg IV daily .
5. Glipizide 2.5 mg p.o. daily .
6. Heparin 5000 units subcutaneous t.i.d.
7. Insulin sliding scale .
8. Levothyroxine 88 micrograms p.o. daily .
9. _____________ 12.5 mg p.o. daily .
10. Valsartan 160 mg p.o. daily .
PHYSICAL EXAMINATION :
VITAL SIGNS :
Stable at discharge .
Laboratories and chart were reviewed .
The patient was interviewed .
GENERAL :
Alert and oriented .
NECK :
Neck supple ; JVP is not elevated .
CARDIOVASCULAR :
S1 and S2 sounds are heard .
No murmur , rub , or gallop .
CHEST :
Bilateral fine inspiratory crackles and crepitations consistent with pulmonary fibrosis .
No audible wheeze .
ABDOMEN :
Abdomen is soft .
PERTINENT LABORATORIES :
Troponin is less than 0.10 times three .
Creatinine 1.1 , sodium 141 , BUN 12 , estimated GFR 51 ml per minute , potassium 4.2 , glucose 131 .
Serum iron 42 , TIBC 241 .
LDL 90 , cholesterol 150 .
Hemoglobin 11.1 , hematocrit 31.8 .
B-type natriuretic peptide 510 .
CHEST RADIOGRAPH :
Chest radiograph revealed bilateral small pleural effusions , heart appeared enlarged , no mediastinal mass , cardiomegaly , with small bilateral effusion .
RECOMMENDATIONS :
1. We will obtain an adenosine stress study to rule out reversible myocardial ischemia .
2. Also , she has been scheduled for a transthoracic echocardiogram to evaluate pulmonary hypertension and her right - sided pressures .
3. I have counseled her to use home oxygen regularly .
4. Lipid profile was reviewed , currently her LDL is within accepted goal .
No further recommendations .
___________________________________
**NAME[YYY ZZZ] , M.D.
Dictator :
**NAME[YYY ZZZ] , M.D.
AN/lsm
D :
**DATE[Jul 18 2007] 10:26:51
T :
**DATE[Jul 18 2007] 20:12:07
R :
**DATE[Jul 18 2007] 20:12:07/lsm
Job ID :
351193/**ID-NUM
Cc:
*** Dictated By :
-**NAME[ZZZ , VVV] ***
Electronically Signed by **NAME[YYY ZZZ]
**DATE[Jul 28 2007] 10:09:04 PM
